showScoreExcerpt:
"An astonishing feat of theatrical immersion…'The Great Comet' brings a comfy, postmodern approach to telling Tolstoy’s story…'The Great Comet' is an impressive theatrical achievement. Director Chavkin has taken Malloy’s very risky concept and has created an interactive production that isn’t over-anxious to please. The show is compelling, exciting, and welcoming. Who would have guessed that a hunk of 'War and Peace' could be such an enormous amount of fun?"
